The bill provides protection against consumer identity theft by health insurance exchange navigators and nonnavigator assistants. The bill sets forth purpose. The bill requires applications and registrations. The bill sets forth application requirements and registration qualifications. The bill permits a fee. The bill sets forth who is prohibited from applying. The bill sets forth disqualification periods. The bill establishes a registered navigator and nonnavigator assister list. The bill provides for a notice of change of registrant information. The bill sets forth prohibited conduct. The bill permits registrations to be denied, revoked or suspended. The bill permits hearings. The bill establishes fines and penalties. The bill defines terms. The bill provides rule-making authority.

2012.title: Ensuring SWA Closure Cost Assistance Funds facilitate closure of certain county landfills
2012.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Secretary of the Department of Environmental Protection to make money available in the Solid Waste Facility Closure Cost Assistance Fund to facilitate the complete closure of the Elkins-Randolph County Landfill, the Webster County Landfill and the Prichard Landfill after it is obtained by the Wayne County Commission.

2013.title: Relating to domestic violence victims' eligibility for unemployment compensation benefits
2013.description: The purpose of this bill is to prevent an individual from being disqualified from receiving unemployment compensation benefits when their separation from employment is due to domestic violence, sexual offenses or stalking by family or household members. The individual must seek and accept new suitable work in order to remain eligible for benefits. The bill provides that the employer is not chargeable for benefits paid when the separation from work is for those reasons.

2014.title: Redesignating Division of Corrections as Department of Corrections
2014.description: The purpose of this bill is to redesignate the Division of Corrections as the Department of Corrections and to provide that the department be supervised by a secretary level administrator.

2015.title: Providing affirmative defense against mechanic's liens related to residential construction
2015.description: The purpose of this bill is to add language to West Virginia Code providing for affirmative defenses against mechanic’s liens related to residential construction projects.

2016.title: Eliminating notarization of articles of incorporation for cooperative associations
2016.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate the notarization requirement for articles of incorporation of cooperative associations, to make it consistent with other business organization’s filing procedures.

2017.last_action: To House Small Business, Entrepreneurship and Economic Development
2017.title: Exempting certain foreign corporations, companies and partnerships from SOS certificate of authority requirement
2017.description: The purpose of this bill is to specify and centralize exemptions for corporations, limited liability companies, limited partnerships and limited liability partnerships. The bill amends decentralized exemptions of limited liability companies to make them equivalent to corporations. The bill sets this as the standard for limited partnerships and limited liability partnerships as well.

2018.title: Distributing portion of Greyhound Breeder Development Fund previously dedicated to training facility construction
2018.description: The purpose of this bill is to distribute money that was set aside from the West Virginia Greyhound Breeder Development Fund for two dog training track facilities to West Virginia residents who had earnings from the West Virginia Greyhound Breeder Development Fund for the period 1996 through 2001, since is not economically feasible to construct and maintain two dog training track facilities.

2019.title: Relating to financing statements covering as-extracted collateral or timber to be cut
2019.description: This bill provides that a record of a mortgage that is effective as a financing statement covering as-extracted collateral or timber to be cut remains effective as a financing statement covering as-extracted collateral or timber to be cut until the mortgage is released or satisfied of record or its effectiveness otherwise terminates as to the real property.

2020.title: Establishing cook-meal ratios for full-day and half-day school cooks
2020.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish cook-meal ratios for full-day and half-day cooks in schools.

2021.title: Clarifying mobile home permanently attached to real estate is not personal property under certain conditions
2021.description: This bill clarifies that a mobile home permanently attached to the real estate by the owner may not be classified as personal property if the owner has filed a canceled certificate of title with the clerk of the county commission and the clerk has recorded the canceled certificate of title. The bill increases the fee charged by the Commissioner of the Division of Motor Vehicles for cancelling a title from $10 to $20. The bill provides that the Commission is to forward $10 of each $20 collected to the clerk of the county commission where the application for cancellation is recorded. The bill also establishes a procedure for returning the recorded application for cancellation.

2022.title: Providing educational incentives and longevity pay for State Troopers
2022.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide educational incentives and longevity pay to state troopers. There is a tremendous need to retain our trained, experienced State Police, not only to maintain our mid-level officers and mentors but to save the cost of training new cadets to replace them.

2023.title: Providing for construction of statewide fiber optic broadband infrastructure network
2023.description: Providing for construction of statewide fiber optic broadband infrastructure network

2024.title: Making Department of Corrections and DHHR subject to OSHA
2024.description: The purpose of this bill is to make the Department of Corrections and the Department of Health, and their respective workplaces, subject to the Occupational Safety and Health Act.

2025.title: Providing for unitization of interests in horizontal oil and gas wells
2025.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the unitization of interests in drilling units in connection with horizontal oil and gas wells. The bill makes findings. The bill declares policy. The bill sets forth application requirements. The bill establishes the standard of review. The bill provides for unit orders. The bill requires notice and timeliness. The bill provides for hearings. The bill provides a standard of review. The bill addressing oil and gas produced from horizontal wells, vertical wells and unconventional reservoirs. The bill provides for conflict resolution. The bill adds new definitions and modifies existing definitions.

2026.title: Creating Land Reuse Agency Authorization Act
2026.description: The purpose of this bill is to improve housing development and land use in West Virginia by providing an option to all municipalities, counties or combinations to create a land banking program in order to eliminate blight and address vacant, delinquent or foreclosed properties.

2027.title: Permitting wine sales at certain college and university sports stadiums
2027.description: The purpose of this bill permits the sale of wine at certain college and university sports stadiums. The bill establishes the conditions under which wine may be sold. The bill sets a licensing fee. The bill establishes who may hold a license. The bill grants the authority to grant waivers and exceptions and to revoke licenses. The bill states where wine may be served. The bill defines a term and authorizes rulemaking.

2028.title: Relating to equipment movement in underground coal mines
2028.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that mining equipment being transported or trammed underground where energized trolley wire exists, other than ordinary sectional movement be done by qualified personnel under supervision of a certified foreman.

2029.title: Providing for closure and sale of Clements State Tree Nursery
2029.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for phasing out of operations at the Division of Forestry's Clements State Nursery. After cessation of operations on or before July 1, 2017, the facility is to be sold for fair market value and the proceeds deposited in the state General Revenue Fund.

2030.title: Permitting emergency rule-making authority to implement Spay Neuter Assistance Program
2030.description: The purpose of this bill is permit emergency rule-making authority to implement the provisions of the West Virginia Spay Neuter Assistance Program.

2031.title: Relating to expiration and renewal of Board of Registration for Professional Engineers' certificates
2031.description: The purpose of this bill is, with regard to professional engineers firms, to change the license year from the fiscal year to the calendar year, discontinue the requirement to mail renewal notices, and authorize emergency rules to provide for 2-year renewals.

2032.title: Removing unconstitutional language regarding access to rail lines
2032.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove unconstitutional language regarding open access to rail lines in West Virginia, following the decision in Association of Am. R.R. v. Public Serv. Comm’n, 745 F. Supp. 1175 (S.D.W. Va. 1989).

2033.title: Removing unconstitutional language regarding jurors and verdicts in certain civil litigation
2033.description: The purpose of this bill is to remove unconstitutional language regarding the number of jurors and types of verdicts permitted in certain civil litigation, following the West Virginia Supreme Court of Appeals decision in Louk v. Cormier, 218 W. Va. 81, 622 S.E.2d 788 (2005).

2034.title: Requiring licensing of athletic trainers by Board of Physical Therapy
2034.description: The purpose of this bill is to require that athletic trainers be licensed by the West Virginia Board of Physical Therapy instead of registered.

2035.title: Allowing law enforcement obtain DNA samples from certain arrestees
2035.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow law enforcement to obtain DNA samples from arrestees for first and second degree murder, kidnaping, first and second degree sexual assault, aggravated robbery or malicious wounding.

2036.title: Authorizing issuance of Family of Fallen Hero license plates
2036.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the issuance of special "Family of Fallen Hero" registration plates.

2037.title: Creating Clearance for Access: Registry and Employment Screening Act
2037.description: The purpose of this article is to require background checks for individuals who have direct access to residents, members or beneficiaries of covered providers participating in the West Virginia Clearance for Access: Registry and Employment Screening program. The bill defines terms. The bill requires the Secretary of the Department of Health and Human Resources to develop a plan and a program for conducting background checks. The bill requires a centralized database to maintain criminal history record information and results. The bill establishes a prescreening process conducted by covered providers. The bill requires applicants to provide fingerprints and undergo a criminal background check. The bill establishes procedures and criteria for obtaining and reviewing criminal history record information. The bill establishes criteria for approving applicants as covered individuals. The bill authorizes contractors and fees. The bill creates a special revenue account for administrative fees. The bill provides for protests of the secretary’s decisions and permitting variances. The bill creates exceptions. The bill authorizes legislative rules. The bill provides monetary penalties. The bill provides for civil and criminal immunity.

2038.title: Updating obsolete definitions of "solid waste" in DEP and solid waste management statutes
2038.description: The purpose of this bill is to update obsolete definitions of solid waste in

2039.title: Creating felony offense of knowingly leaving crash scene resulting in serious bodily injury
2039.description: The purpose of this bill is to define the act of leaving the scene of a crash involving death or serious bodily injury as felonies. The bill also establishes certain presumptions of knowledge based upon the circumstances of a vehicle crash.

2040.title: Authorizing issuance of limited lines travel insurance producer license
2040.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the Insurance Commissioner to issue a limited lines travel insurance producer license to a business entity and to allow travel retailers and their employees to offer and disseminate travel insurance under the limited lines travel insurance business entity producer license.

2042.title: Including waste management facilities and timber operations in facilities with protection against property crimes
2042.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for protection against property crimes committed against coal mines, utilities and other industrial facilities. The bill adds waste management facilities and timber operations to the protected facilities and provides for criminal penalties for the removal, destruction, or damage of real or personal property that impairs the normal operation any equipment or system used for the protection of health and safety of any person. This bill is the same as H.B. 4226.

2043.last_action: Recommitted to Banking and Insurance on 3rd reading
2043.title: Modifying statute of limitations on demand note collections
2043.description: The purpose of this bill is to modify the statute of limitations on the collection of demand notes.

2044.title: Clarifying regulation of nonintoxicating beer brewers and distributors
2044.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify the regulation of nonintoxicating beer brewers and distributors, agreements, networks, products, brands and extensions of a line of brands. The bill permits the commissioner to investigate, review and approve or deny franchise agreements, labels, brands and line extensions. The bill provides hearings. The bill extends certain dates. The bill establishes nonintoxicating beer, resident brewers, distributors, franchise distributor networks and line extensions standards. The bill defines terms. The bill provides sanctions. The bill authorizes rule-making.

2045.last_action: Senator M. Hall requests to be removed as sponsor of bill
2045.title: Providing excess Courtesy Patrol funds revert to Tourism Promotion Fund
2045.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for excess funds in the Courtesy Patrol Fund to revert to the Tourism Promotion Fund.

2046.title: Providing exemption from skilled nursing bed moratorium for speciality skilled nursing beds
2046.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide an exemption from the moratorium on skilled nursing beds for beds that would be operated as geriatric psychological beds.

2047.title: Relating to municipal ordinance compliance regarding dwellings unfit for habitation and vacant buildings and properties
2047.description: Relating to municipal ordinance compliance regarding dwellings unfit for habitation and vacant buildings and properties

2048.title: Relating to property assessment appeals
2048.description: Removing unconstitutional language regarding relief in circuit court against erroneous assessments

2049.title: Requiring health care providers wear ID badges
2049.description: Requiring health care providers wear ID badges

2050.title: Relating to testing for presence of methane in underground mines
2050.description: Requiring automatic de-energization of mine extraction apparatus when certain methane concentration exists

2053.description: Implementing exotic entertainment facility license surcharge

2054.title: Providing act of domestic violence or sexual offense by strangling is aggravated felony
2054.description: Providing act of domestic violence or sexual offense by strangling is aggravated felony

2055.description: Relating to bicycle safety on roadways

2057.description: Requiring health insurance coverage for certain nonnarcotic pain relief systems

2058.title: Increasing county solid waste assessment fee; exemption
2058.description: Increasing county solid waste assessment fee; exemption

2059.description: Discontinuing moratorium on commercial rafting licenses on portion of New River

2060.description: Expanding definition of "eligible safety property" in Innovative Mine Safety Technology Tax Credit Act

2066.description: Exempting certain critical access hospitals from certificate of need requirement

2067.description: Authorizing State Police Superintendent to hire additional staff

2070.description: Requiring notification of certain substance abuse screening of mine personnel
